conclusion: Block P has mass m, Block Q has mass 4m, Q is initially at rest at point A, P collides elastically with Q, moving upward with velocity v_0, Coefficient of kinetic friction between Q and the plane is tan Î¸, No friction between P and the plane, The collision between P and the bumper is perfectly elastic
Conservation of momentum equation is v_0 = v_{P_1} + 4v_{Q_1}
Conservation of kinetic energy equation is v_0^2 = v_{P_1}^2 + 4v_{Q_1}^2
Relative velocity equation for elastic collision is v_{Q_1} - v_{P_1} = -v_0
Solve for v_{P_1} using v_{Q_1} = v_{P_1} - v_0
Substitute v_{Q_1} = v_{P_1} - v_0 into momentum equation to find v_{P_1} = v_0
Substitute v_{P_1} = v_0 into v_{Q_1} = v_{P_1} - v_0 to find v_{Q_1} = 0
Recalculate using corrected relative velocity equation v_{P_1} - v_{Q_1} = -v_0
Substitute v_{P_1} = v_{Q_1} - v_0 into momentum equation to find v_{Q_1} = 2v_0/5
Substitute v_{Q_1} = 2v_0/5 into v_{P_1} = v_{Q_1} - v_0 to find v_{P_1} = -3v_0/5
Verify solution satisfies conservation of energy equation v_0^2 = v_{P_1}^2 + 4v_{Q_1}^2
